ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix on OS X
ygData.msgSnippet: Michael, Many thanks for your tips. I have a feeling I am doing something fundamental and waffleheaded, but have little or no knowledge of just how and where

From: Robert Mothershead <azimuthllc@...>
Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix on OS X
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=214000419; y=MjyMVXDzvynamLGV9ngEufCqmqcXO76Sv8N5jxs9bD4nDPMsXEyGHota_UQ
X-Yahoo-Profile: robertmothershead

Michael,

Many thanks for your tips. I have a feeling I am doing something fundamental
and waffleheaded, but have little or no knowledge of just how and where my
lapse is occurring.

But I did learn I earlier did not have a .MacOSX directory, nor an
environmental.plist file within it. So created both and relogged in. Nada.
My plist file looks like this; should I be using a different variable other
than /usr, perhaps my home directory name of /robertmothershead?


<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE plist PUBLIC "-//Apple Computer//DTD PLIST 1.0//EN"
"http://www.apple.com/DTDs/PropertyList-1.0.dtd">
<plist version="1.0">
<dict>
        <key>JAVA_HOME</key>
        <string>/usr</string>
</dict>
</plist>

Console messages: Does the NoInitialContextException message seems to
suggest I've put something in the wrong directory or other issue?

Mac OS X Version 10.4.6 (Build 8I127)

In the meantime I am going to install a much earlier version of Heritrix and
see if that makes a difference.

Thanks for your patience and attention on this, Michael.

rm







> From: Michael Stack <stack@...>
> Reply-To: <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
> Date: Sun, 04 Jun 2006 12:52:46 -0700
> To: <archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Heritrix on OS X
> 
> Robert Mothershead wrote:
>> ...
>> 
>> Not sure what to do after this and am concerned about bolloxing it up
>> to the
>> point where my limited knowledge prevents me from fixing it.
>> 
>> So far, I have performed a "set java_home=/usr" command in the terminal.
> 
> The  variable name is 'JAVA_HOME', not 'java_home'. Try:
> 
> set JAVA_HOME=/usr
> 
> See if that works,
> St.Ack
> 
> 
>
